API Reference#

Main Module#

Main application module that handles the initialization and running of the 3D viewer application. This module coordinates between the Flask API server and the Pyglet graphics window.

class main.GameWindow#

Bases: BaseWindow

Main application window that handles 3D rendering using Pyglet.

This class manages the OpenGL context and coordinates with the render system to display 3D models. It inherits from pyglet.window.Window to provide basic window functionality.

on_draw()#

Handle the window’s draw event by clearing and rendering the scene.

on_resize(width, height)#

Handle window resize events.

trigger_redraw()#

Schedule a redraw of the window on the next frame.

update_projection(width, height)#

Update the projection matrix with the given dimensions.

main.run_flask_app()#

Start the Flask API server in a separate thread.

This function configures and runs the Flask application that handles HTTP requests for model manipulation.

main.run_pyglet()#

Initialize and run the Pyglet event loop.

This function sets up both the platform event loop and the main event loop required for proper Pyglet operation.

API Module#

API module that provides HTTP endpoints for interacting with the 3D viewer.

This module implements a REST API using Flask to allow external applications to control the 3D viewer, including model loading, manipulation, and window management.

api.add_entity()#
api.error_response(data=None, status_code=400)#

Create a standardized error response.

Parameters:

  • data (dict, optional) – Error data to include in the response

  • status_code (int, optional) – HTTP status code to return

Returns:

(JSON response, HTTP status code)

Return type:

tuple

api.health_check()#
api.init_window()#

Initialize the 3D viewer window.

This endpoint creates a new window if one doesn’t already exist. The window creation is scheduled on the Pyglet event loop to ensure thread safety.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or failure

api.remove_entity(entity_id)#
api.success_response(data=None)#

Create a standardized success response.

Parameters:

data (dict, optional) – Data to include in the response

Returns:

(JSON response, HTTP status code)

Return type:

tuple

api.update_entity(entity_id)#
api.validate_entity_parameters(parameters)#
